hanzi-su-wiki:
較

Значения

Сравнивать

Мнемоника

Связь 交 колес в арбе 車. Подгонять, сравнивая, добиваясь их одинаковости, что влияет на качество хода.

Варианты

较
purpleculture_pinyin:
jiào
to compare; to dispute; compared to; (before adj.) relatively; comparatively; rather; also pr. [jiao3]
сравнивать; чтобы оспаривать; в сравнении с; (перед прил.) относительно; сравнительно; скорее; также пр. [jiao3]
rtega_mnemonic:
較較RS
较较		compare, comparatively, more
  • RS. compete by racing carts 車 together 交
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 较)
Pictophonetic: 交 indicates the sound; 車 (cart) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
較為 [ jiào wéi ]: comparatively; relatively; fairly
較量 [ jiào liàng ]: to pit oneself against sb; to compete with sb; contest; battle; to haggle; to quibble
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 車 [ chē ] cart, vehicle; to move in a cart
    • 交 [ jiāo ] to connect; to deliver, to exchange; to intersect; to mix
heisig_chinese_memo: I don't mingle with car lovers because that's all they want to talk about so they are relatively uninteresting. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: contrast, car, mingle, top hat, father
koohiiStory1: The people I had invited to the party were mingling quite well with one another, until they all suddenly started talking about the cars they own. Pretty soon the crowd divided itself into distinct, contrasting crowds: rich snobs with fancy cars, soccer moms with minivans, and hippies with bicycles.
koohiiStory2: Our world of today, cars mingling on busy streets, is in stark contrast to the one of yesteryear, where it was people who would mingle on the streets.
jp_example_words:
比較(ひかく): comparison
比較的(ひかくてき): comparatively, relatively
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Your new car doesn’t mix well with the other cars in your garage because its color is in stark contrast to the others. All of your other cars are pristine white in color, but this new car is a mix of lots of colors. It almost looks like a peacock or something it’s so colorful. Such a contrast.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this garage of yours with a sea of white cars. Now there is a new car that really sticks out like a sore thumb. Imagine yourself looking out over your cars and seeing this wacky car practically jumping out at you.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: What did I say this car looks like? Oh that’s right, a peacock (かく). This car looks like a peacock. It’s the color of a peacock and you’ll look like you’re peacocking when you’re out on the town driving it. It really is such a stark contrast to like, every other car out there.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: See yourself driving around in this peacock car. Hear the engine purr as strangers jeer and yell at you. This car sure does get a lot of attention, doesn’t it?
Ru_trainchinese:
jiào: (нареч/предлог) сравнительно, относительно; чем, по сравнению с (вводит объект сравнения)
jiào: (графема) сравнивать, сопоставлять; спорить, препираться
Kanshudo_mnemonic: mix (交) the cars (車) to compare them
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Mingling with cars (driving) can be dangerous, but relatively it's safe.  At least you are not living in a country undergoing civil war.
humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions from " car ", " yao " sound. The glyph of Yi Bo [冬戈] is added next to "攴". "Said Wen" is also called " Fei ". The handed down documents mostly used " comparison ", starting with " che " and " jiao ". " Than the " original meaning of the crossbar on both sides of the car trunk columns. "Said the text": "Wai, the ride on the copper also. From the car, the sound." "The ride" is regarded as a "car constriction", that is, the car rails on both sides of the carriage. Xu Hao's "Shuowen Jiezi Annotation" in the Qing Dynasty: "Yuqian Hengmu is called Shi. The left and right two compartments are called Constriction. Hanging on is called Comparing. Zheng's Note "Kaogongji" says: "Comparison, Hanging up out style It is also.""

Yu Bo [冬戈] 簋 "𠦪帱䡈" means to wrap it with painted animal leather or varnished cloth. (Refer to Ji Xiaojun) For example, "Poetry. Wei Feng. "Qi Ao": "Large and generous, and heavy and heavy." Ma Ruichen, "Mao Shi Zhuan Jian Explanation": "The wood on the car hangs is for comparison, and the hook is decorated with a hook if it is heavy. ." Another example is "Selected Works. Cao Zijian "Seven Qi": "Lean down on Jin Jie, and caress about Cui Gai."

" Comparison " means " corner ", which means competition and competition. "Zhengzitong": "Comparing, competing, and Jiaotong." Such as "Mencius. Wanzhangxia": "Confucius's official position is in Lu Ye. Lu people hunted and Confucius also hunted." Zhao Qi's note: "The hunter, the field hunter is compared to the hunting of animals and animals. Su Xun of the Northern Song Dynasty: "Six Kingdoms": "To make the Three Kingdoms each love their land, the Qi people should not be attached to Qin, the assassins are not good, the good generals are still there, then the number of winners and losers, the principle of survival, should be compared with Qin, or Not easy to measure."

" Compared " means to compare and compare. Such as "Lao Tzu. Chapter Two: "Therefore, there is no intergrowth, the difficulty and the easy, the long and the short, the high and the low, the sound and the sound, follow each other." "Three Kingdoms. Wu Shu. "Yihu Zongzhuan": "Xu Ziyuan gave up Yuan to Cao in the past, planning and planning, should meet and accept, then defeated Yuan Jun, in order to settle Cao's career."

" Compared " means obvious. Such as "Historical Records. "Biography of Boyi": "This is especially great and clearer than the author." Sima Zhensuoyin: "Compared, Mingye." "Lun Heng. "Bone Phase": "The twelve sages of Sri Lanka are all in the throne of the emperor, or the auxiliary master is worried about the world, and the world has been heard by the world, and the Confucianism has been said. Those who are in the classics are more credible."

" Compared " is the same as " school ", which means assessment. Such as "Historical Records. "Tian Jingzhong Ending Family": "If the cart is not compared, it cannot carry his permanent position; if the piano is not compared, it cannot become its five-tone." Sima Zhensuoyin: "Comparison, the amount of school. There is a regular system, if the cart is not compared , Then the car cannot carry permanent posts; if the piano is not compared, the piano cannot be five-tone." It also means correction and correction. Such as Zhang Xuecheng in the Qing Dynasty "School Yu Tongyi. Tenth: "If you want to correct the writings of various schools today, you should come from Liu's "Lie" and Ban's "Zhi" as Quan Yu also."

"Greater comparison" means roughly, roughly. Such as "Historical Records. Biographies of Commodities: "Fu Shanxi Rao wood, bamboo, grain, 纑, 旄, jade; Shandong has more fish, salt, lacquer, silk, sensuality... This is more than that." Sima Zhensuo Yin: "Large is slightly more than Judah. Also." "Hou Han Shu. The Biography of Du Luan, Liu, Li, and Liu Xie: "The eight things are more than the eunuchs in the world."

" Compared " means recovery. For example, Ouyang Xiu of the Northern Song Dynasty, the fifth of "The Book with Wang Yike": "Since the Chinese New Year, a certain child has many illnesses, and a small girl suffers from eyesight. The day has not been compared, and the day is quite worried." Tang Xianzu of the Ming Dynasty "Peony Pavilion. Picking up paintings: "I have more patients in recent days, so I can't sit still."

" Compared " can be used as an adverb to express degree. For example, one of Du Fu's "Ren Day" in the Tang Dynasty: "Ice and snow warblers are hard to come, but the cold spring flowers are late." Bai Juyi "Jianglou Xiwang invites guests": "It is cooler than the monarch's cottage if you can sell the Jianglou."

" Comparative " can also be used as a preposition, which is equivalent to " comparative ." For example, Zhu Yizun of the Qing Dynasty "Qiao Shidu Yifeng Caotang Watching Flower Songs": "This year's spring is late last year, and there are more than two or three flower letters." Zhao Yi's "Waterwheel, Ten and Hundred Rivers into the River": "Definitely like poverty People pay their debts, and the lamb's profit is more than the capital."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription starts with " car " and " yao " sound, the same as "Shuowen". The handed down documents mostly used " comparison ", starting with " che " and " jiao ". The original meaning is the rails on both sides of the carriage.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「車」，「爻」聲。彔伯[冬戈]簋的字形又增「攴」旁。《說文》亦作「䡈」。傳世文獻多作「較」，從「車」，「交」聲。「較」的本義是車箱兩旁車欄上的橫木。《說文》：「䡈，車騎上曲銅也。从車，爻聲。」「車騎」當作「車輢」，即車箱兩旁的車欄。清代徐灝《說文解字注箋》：「輿前橫木謂之軾。左右兩廂謂之輢。輢上謂之較。鄭注〈考工記〉曰：『較，輢上出式者是也。』」

　　彔伯[冬戈]簋「𠦪幬䡈」意謂用有飾畫的獸革或漆布裹於較上。（參冀小軍）古書中的用例如《詩．衛風．淇奧》：「寬兮綽兮，倚重較兮。」馬瑞辰《毛詩傳箋通釋》：「車輢上之木為較，較上更飾以曲鈎若重起者然，是為重較。」又如《文選．曹子建〈七啟〉》：「俯倚金較，仰撫翠蓋。」

　　「較」通「角」，表示比試、競逐。《正字通》：「較，相競也，與角通。」如《孟子．萬章下》：「孔子之仕於魯也，魯人獵較，孔子亦獵較。」趙岐注：「獵較者，田獵相較奪禽獸得之以祭，時俗所尚，以為吉祥。」北宋蘇洵〈六國論〉：「向使三國各愛其地，齊人勿附于秦，刺客不行，良將猶在，則勝負之數，存亡之理，當與秦相較，或未易量。」

　　「較」表示相比、比較。如《老子．第二章》：「故有無相生，難易相成，長短相較，高下相傾，音聲相和，前後相隨。」《三國志．吳書．是儀胡綜傳》：「昔許子遠舍袁就曹，規畫計較，應見納受，遂破袁軍，以定曹業。」

　　「較」表示明顯。如《史記．伯夷列傳》：「此其尤大彰明較著者也。」司馬貞索隱：「較，明也。」《論衡．骨相》：「斯十二聖者，皆在帝王之位，或輔主憂世，世所共聞，儒所共說，在經傳者，較著可信。」

　　「較」同「校」，表示考核。如《史記．田敬仲完世家》：「大車不較，不能載其常任；琴瑟不較，不能成其五音。」司馬貞索隱：「較者，校量也。言有常制，若大車不較，則車不能載常任；琴瑟不較，琴不能成五音。」又表示訂正、校正。如清代章學誠《校讎通義．第十》：「今欲較正諸家著錄，當自劉〈略〉、班〈志〉為權輿也。」

　　「大較」表示大概、大略。如《史記．貨殖列傳》：「夫山西饒材、竹、穀、纑、旄、玉石；山東多魚、鹽、漆、絲、聲色……此其大較也。」司馬貞索隱：「大較猶大略也。」《後漢書．杜欒劉李劉謝列傳》：「其八事，大較言天下大亂，皆由宦官。」

　　「較」表示痊愈。如北宋歐陽修〈與王懿恪公書〉之五：「某自過年，兒女多病，小女子患目，殆今未較，日頗憂煎。」明代湯顯祖《牡丹亭．拾畫》：「日來病患較些，悶坐不過。」

　　「較」可作副詞表示程度。如唐代杜甫〈人日〉之一：「冰雪鶯難至，春寒花較遲。」白居易〈江樓夕望招客〉：「能就江樓銷暑否，比君茅舍較清涼。」

　　「較」亦可作介詞，相當於「比」。如清代朱彝尊〈喬侍讀一峰草堂看花歌〉：「今年春較去年晚，花信十猶餘二三。」趙翼〈水車十百戽田水入河〉之二：「絕似貧人還宿債，羊羔利較本錢多。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「車」，「爻」聲，《說文》同。傳世文獻多作「較」，從「車」，「交」聲。本義是車箱兩旁車欄上的橫木。

較 (Simplified: 较)
Pinyin: jiào
English Definition: to compare; to dispute; compared to; (before adj.) relatively; comparatively; rather; also pr. [jiao3]
Total strokes: 13; Radical: 車
Pictophonetic: 交 indicates the sound; 車 (cart) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 車 [ chē ] cart, vehicle; to move in a cart
    • 交 [ jiāo ] to connect; to deliver, to exchange; to intersect; to mix
Example Words:
較為 [ jiào wéi ]: comparatively; relatively; fairly
較量 [ jiào liàng ]: to pit oneself against sb; to compete with sb; contest; battle; to haggle; to quibble
More: 較* | *較 | *較*

較較RS
较较 		compare, comparatively, more
  • RS. compete by racing carts 車 together 交
(Simplified: 较)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 交 indicates the sound; 車 (cart) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 車 [ chē ] cart, vehicle; to move in a cart
    • 交 [ jiāo ] to connect; to deliver, to exchange; to intersect; to mix
①比：較量(liàng)。較勁(亦作“叫勁”)。比較。計較。
②對比着顯得更進一層的：成績較佳。
③明顯：較然(顯明)。彰明較著。
④大旨，大概：較略。

Chinese: I don't mingle with car lovers because that's all they want to talk about so they are relatively uninteresting.  
koohii1: The people I had invited to the party were mingling quite well with one another, until they all suddenly started talking about the cars they own. Pretty soon the crowd divided itself into distinct, contrasting crowds: rich snobs with fancy cars, soccer moms with minivans, and hippies with bicycles.
koohii2: Our world of today, cars mingling on busy streets, is in stark contrast to the one of yesteryear, where it was people who would mingle on the streets.
Meaning: relatively
Hanzi: 较
Story: Mingling with cars (driving) can be dangerous, but relatively it's safe. At least you are not living in a country undergoing civil war.

比較(ひかく): comparison
比較的(ひかくてき): comparatively, relatively

金文從「 車 」，「 爻 」聲。彔伯[冬戈]簋的字形又增「 攴 」旁。《說文》亦作「 䡈 」。傳世文獻多作「 較 」，從「 車 」，「 交 」聲。「 較 」的本義是車箱兩旁車欄上的橫木。《說文》：「䡈，車騎上曲銅也。从車，爻聲。」「車騎」當作「車輢」，即車箱兩旁的車欄。清代徐灝《說文解字注箋》：「輿前橫木謂之軾。左右兩廂謂之輢。輢上謂之較。鄭注〈考工記〉曰：『較，輢上出式者是也。』」 彔伯[冬戈]簋「𠦪幬䡈」意謂用有飾畫的獸革或漆布裹於較上。（參冀小軍）古書中的用例如《詩．衛風．淇奧》：「寬兮綽兮，倚重較兮。」馬瑞辰《毛詩傳箋通釋》：「車輢上之木為較，較上更飾以曲鈎若重起者然，是為重較。」又如《文選．曹子建〈七啟〉》：「俯倚金較，仰撫翠蓋。」 「 較 」通「 角 」，表示比試、競逐。《正字通》：「較，相競也，與角通。」如《孟子．萬章下》：「孔子之仕於魯也，魯人獵較，孔子亦獵較。」趙岐注：「獵較者，田獵相較奪禽獸得之以祭，時俗所尚，以為吉祥。」北宋蘇洵〈六國論〉：「向使三國各愛其地，齊人勿附于秦，刺客不行，良將猶在，則勝負之數，存亡之理，當與秦相較，或未易量。」 「 較 」表示相比、比較。如《老子．第二章》：「故有無相生，難易相成，長短相較，高下相傾，音聲相和，前後相隨。」《三國志．吳書．是儀胡綜傳》：「昔許子遠舍袁就曹，規畫計較，應見納受，遂破袁軍，以定曹業。」 「 較 」表示明顯。如《史記．伯夷列傳》：「此其尤大彰明較著者也。」司馬貞索隱：「較，明也。」《論衡．骨相》：「斯十二聖者，皆在帝王之位，或輔主憂世，世所共聞，儒所共說，在經傳者，較著可信。」 「 較 」同「 校 」，表示考核。如《史記．田敬仲完世家》：「大車不較，不能載其常任；琴瑟不較，不能成其五音。」司馬貞索隱：「較者，校量也。言有常制，若大車不較，則車不能載常任；琴瑟不較，琴不能成五音。」又表示訂正、校正。如清代章學誠《校讎通義．第十》：「今欲較正諸家著錄，當自劉〈略〉、班〈志〉為權輿也。」 「大較」表示大概、大略。如《史記．貨殖列傳》：「夫山西饒材、竹、穀、纑、旄、玉石；山東多魚、鹽、漆、絲、聲色……此其大較也。」司馬貞索隱：「大較猶大略也。」《後漢書．杜欒劉李劉謝列傳》：「其八事，大較言天下大亂，皆由宦官。」 「 較 」表示痊愈。如北宋歐陽修〈與王懿恪公書〉之五：「某自過年，兒女多病，小女子患目，殆今未較，日頗憂煎。」明代湯顯祖《牡丹亭．拾畫》：「日來病患較些，悶坐不過。」 「 較 」可作副詞表示程度。如唐代杜甫〈人日〉之一：「冰雪鶯難至，春寒花較遲。」白居易〈江樓夕望招客〉：「能就江樓銷暑否，比君茅舍較清涼。」 「 較 」亦可作介詞，相當於「 比 」。如清代朱彝尊〈喬侍讀一峰草堂看花歌〉：「今年春較去年晚，花信十猶餘二三。」趙翼〈水車十百戽田水入河〉之二：「絕似貧人還宿債，羊羔利較本錢多。」

Name meaning

jué, jiào, xiào
вм. 较
Radicals: 車, 交  (car, mix)
Meaning Mnemonic
Your new car doesn’t mix well with the other cars in your garage because its color is in stark contrast to the others. All of your other cars are pristine white in color, but this new car is a mix of lots of colors. It almost looks like a peacock or something it’s so colorful. Such a contrast.
Imagine this garage of yours with a sea of white cars. Now there is a new car that really sticks out like a sore thumb. Imagine yourself looking out over your cars and seeing this wacky car practically jumping out at you.
Reading Mnemonic
What did I say this car looks like? Oh that’s right, a peacock (かく). This car looks like a peacock. It’s the color of a peacock and you’ll look like you’re peacocking when you’re out on the town driving it. It really is such a stark contrast to like, every other car out there.
See yourself driving around in this peacock car. Hear the engine purr as strangers jeer and yell at you. This car sure does get a lot of attention, doesn’t it?
